text: Indian equity benchmarks declined for a third day amidst weakness in the broader Asian indices. Markets in Asia were trading mostly lower in the backdrop of a weak close in the U.S., as geopolitical tensions with North Korea escalated.The declines in the Indian equity indices were led by sell-offs in pharma and realty stocks. The S&P BSE Sensex Index and the NSE Nifty 50 Index fell as much as 0.5 percent to 31,843.75 and 9,925.90 respectively.The market breadth was firmly tilted in favour of the sellers. About 1,157 stocks declined while 364 advanced on the NSE.
title: Stocks Radar: Sun Pharma, Tata Chemicals, Titan
